newsitem.title: USA: Tokheim sees sales base double on Sofitam.
newsitem.headline: Tokheim sees sales base double on Sofitam.

text.p: Tokheim Corp said it expects its acquisition of Sofitam SA to roughly double its full year sales base to more than $400 million.

"In addition to the clear opportunity to grow our sales base, we plan to consolidate overseas factory operations in Europe, along the lines of our domestic consolidation in 1996, which should provide additional cost savings and enhance on-going profitability," the company said.

Tokheim reported Friday a sharp increase in fiscal 1996 operating profits on a 26-percent increase in sales. The sales gain reflected, in large part, the company's September 6 acquisition of the petroleum dispensing business of Paris, France-based Sofitam, it said.

"We are more than delighted by the initial contribution from the Sofitam acquisition and expect improvements in sales and earnings from the strategic advantages gained from the combination of the two companies," Tokheim said.
Tokheim makes and services gasoline dispensers.
